title: International Entrepreneurial Mindset 2024-2025
description:
The International Entrepreneurial Mindset online course is a comprehensive 27-hour program developed by 25 educators from the EDUC Alliance and designed to equip PhD students with critical work-related transversal skills essential for successful career transitions. Whether you're moving out of academia or entering the professional market, this course provides the tools you need to thrive in today‚Äôs dynamic job landscape. 

Modules in this course:

Part 1: Coming Out of Academia (11 hours) 

Communication, Rebound on your research, Networking - Intercultural relations and cultural codes, European professional opportunities

Part 2: Entering the Professional Market (16 hours) 

How to integrate design thinking into an entrepreneurial mindset, Reflecting on the social impact of your activities and acting accordingly, Set up an action plan, Emotional intelligence, Risk management and problem solving, Collaboration and management

Outcomes you can expect:

Master work-related transversal skills: Gain critical competencies that apply across industries: problem-solving, design thinking, social impact, leadership, and more. 

Linguistic competency in English: A course entirely in English, you will strengthen your ability to engage in professional and entrepreneurial activities in an international context. 

Professional insertion: Equip yourself with the tools to seamlessly integrate into the professional world, whether in corporate, nonprofit, or entrepreneurial settings. 

European expertise: Benefit from the knowledge of top educators across Europe, who understand the unique challenges and opportunities facing international PhD students. 

Flexible and practical learning: Study at your own pace with a focus on real-world applications, preparing you to confidently step into a dynamic global job market.
prerequisites: B1 level in English\n\nOpen to PhD candidates
details:
Self-paced

1st session: from 4 November 2024 to 7 March 2025

From year 1 of your PhD  

Open to all profiles and disciplines 

Several sessions will be offered throughout the year 

Receive an EDUC Certificate of Competences for your skills portfolio
summary: The International Entrepreneurial Mindset online course is a comprehensive 27-hour program developed by 25 educators from the EDUC Alliance and designed to equip PhD students with critical work-rel...

title: Scientific research: sources, tools and evaluation
description: The course aims to introduce the topics of scientific communication, copyright, Open Access/Open Science, and research evaluation. The aim is to acquire the skills to carry out bibliographic searches, to know how to use information in a responsible way, to produce new knowledge by disseminating results in an open form, to understand the functioning of the research evaluation system. The main tools for conducting effective bibliographic searches on resources in the field will be presented (this module will be differentiated according to the relevant subject area) and elements for handling data in an open manner will be provided. At the end of the course, the learner will have a better understanding of electronic research infrastructures, of the tools and services available for publishing results, including open access, and of how to assess the scientific productivity of researchers.
details: The course will consist of 3 recorded plenary meetings held in Italian, each lasting 2 hours with an additional 30 minutes for questions, for all students. In addition, there are 4 recorded sectorial meetings;
further_information: The recorded sessions are conducted in Italian but are subtitled in English.

title: MOOC - Training to Teach in Higher Education (In French)
description:
At the end of the course, you will be able to:

-Design your teaching, respecting pedagogical alignment, writing learning objectives, taking into account the integration of your course into a program.

-Support students' learning, drawing on the cognitive mechanisms of motivation and active pedagogy, and using digital tools.

-Evaluate student learning, in line with learning objectives and taking into account your teaching context.


You must register with your institutional (student) address via the following link: https://www.fun-mooc.fr/fr/cours/se-former-pour-enseigner-dans-le-superieur/


Description

The MOOC "Se former pour enseigner dans le Sup√©rieur", piloted by the French Ministry of Higher Education, Research and Innovation and coordinated by the University of Rennes, opens its 8th edition in January 2025, and is offered as a distance learning course.
The MOOC covers 4 key themes. The course extends over 12 weeks, and you will be accompanied throughout this period (from January 06, 2025 to April 04, 2025). Each theme is covered over two weeks, giving participants time to consult resources, complete quizzes and activities, and exchange teaching methods.

-Designing your teaching

-Supporting learning through activities

-Assessing student learning 

-Building a teaching team

  

You'll build up a rich and varied base of knowledge and skills, enabling you to develop new teaching practices or consolidate existing skills.
details:
24 hour workload

2025 session online. Contact the EDUC team in Rennes (educ@univ-rennes.fr) to enroll.

title: MOOC - Ethics in Research (In French)
description:
Description

This MOOC was designed in 2018 within the University of Lyon's Research Ethics Platform.

Since May 2015, all PhD students have been required to train in scientific integrity and research ethics. The MOOC offered by the University of Lyon, focusing on research ethics, is aimed primarily at PhD students, but concerns all researchers and citizens who wish to reflect on the contemporary transformations and implications of research, and the new ethical issues they raise.

This MOOC complements the one on scientific integrity offered by the University of Bordeaux since November 2018.

Science is a core value of our democratic societies, which promote the desire for knowledge of the world and mankind. Nevertheless, new techno-scientific achievements and the acceleration of innovations sometimes frighten. In addition, the scale of the resources mobilized, a system of international competition and conflicts of interest between private and common good are also giving rise to a crisis of confidence.

How can we assume our responsibilities as citizens and researchers, on a personal, collective and institutional level?

The various themes addressed are: 

- Ethics and science today? 

- What is research ethics? 

- Why is ethics part of science?

- Science, technology, innovation and democracy

- The responsibility of researchers and institutions

- Conflicts of interest

- Conflicts of values
details: 2024-2025 Session online.\nMembers of the EDUC Alliance should contact \neduc@univ-rennes.fr or connect to the application link to enroll.

title: Understand and define your choices for sharing your research results in an open science ecosystem
description: The scientific, technological, economic and digital environment for researchers has been changing rapidly for several years. The aim of this open science training course is to give you a pracGcal, factual overview of public policies on opening up, sharing and protecGng publicly-funded scienGfic publicaGons and other academic research output at European level. To do this, we will discover the publicaGons ecosystem, and together we will grasp the issues involved in choosing whether to share your scienGfic research results selecGvely or in their enGrety.\n
prerequisites: Any prerequisites required ; Phd students from all the EDUC universities

title: German Assistant (Spain)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
30-40

**Preferred start date**
7/1/2025

**Preferred end date**
7/7/2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible. The organisation can accept also accept interns in summer.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
PROYECTO ESPA√ëOL consists of four schools specialised in Spanish as a foreign language with headquarters in the most touristy cities, such as Alicante or Granada and with collaborators in Barcelona and Madrid.
Our aim is simple: combine teaching Spanish with experiences beyond the classroom, achieving total immersion in history, culture and social life

**Description of the tasks**
As an assistant of our German school, you will be involved in many different tasks, always staying positive and having a smile on your face when dealing with students.
MAIN TASKS: Support of the German Department (students and teachers).
Supplementary lessons to Spanish students learning German.
Organising the conversation exchange with International students.
Produce supplementary teaching materials and participate in classes as required. ? Provide support to our marketing department.
Supporting social media efforts in German (Create material for our German blog and other social networks).
Assist in the distribution or delivery of marketing materials.
Schedule and coordinate speaking engagements, appearances, photo shoots, and other special events.
Assist with mailings, print production, etc.
Create or update databases. ? Assisting in Front Office as required.
Greet students.
Commercial information to customers.
Answering all calls promptly in a courteous and efficient manner.
Open and sort mail.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Problem solving
Interpersonal skills
Ability in organising and planning
Oral and written communication in the native language
Elementary computer skills
Decision making
Teamwork
Knowledge of a foreign language
Ability to learn
Will to succeed

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
Spanish course offered by the company and special price for accommodation.

**Host organisation support: financial support**
This is a non-paid internship.

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Monthly

**Additional requirements**
Spanish B1 or higher (we could accept Spanish beginners depending on candidate).

Applied science  /  Education

title: Cybersecurity (Italy)
description:
**Duration of the internship**
6 months

**Hours per week**
25

**Preferred start date**
From January 2025

*The organisation has indicated that the start and end dates are flexible.

**Further information about host organisation and relevant links**
Iuniperus Srl

**Description of the tasks**
Cyber Security: Management Systematic control of environments to identify and record threats, weaknesses, non-conformities
Analysis of the company's critical assets to identify vulnerabilities with respect to intrusions or attacks
Systematic control of environments to identify and record threats, weaknesses, non-compliance
Analysis of the company's critical assets to identify vulnerabilities with respect to intrusions or attacks
Apply control protocols and address critical issues related to the security of the information system, implementing recovery plans in the event of a crisis
Daily monitoring of the main Information Security channels (mailing lists, forums, etc.) in order to:
 - detect the presence of new potentially impactful zero-day vulnerabilities or threats that could impact the IT assets being managed and direct the appropriate remedial interventions.

- creation of a mapping of the application stack for the provision of the services of interest, in order to build a Knowledge Base of the IT services useful for the subsequent definition of an automatic notification process for new vulnerabilities that require corrective interventions.

**Description of skills and competencies to be developed**
Ability to analyse and synthesise
Problem solving
Information management skills
Interpersonal skills
Teamwork
Ability to apply knowledge in practice
Ability to adapt to new situations
Understanding of cultures and customs of other countries
Ability to work in an interdisciplinary team
Ability to learn

**Host organisation support: logistic support**
Transportation, dedicated furniture, remote work options

**Host organisation support: financial support**
Insurance

**Host organisation support: mentoring conditions**
Daily / weekly

**Additional requirements**
Not listed.

**Application process**
CV Evaluation
Recommendation Letter Evaluation
Motivation Letter Evaluation
Interview


**Field of studies**
Formal science  /  Computer science

**Level of studies**
Bachelor Year 4
